definition: to disperse in confusion (idiom)
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
tumult/uproar/commotion/disturbance
to deceive/to coax/to amuse (a child)
variant of 鬨|哄[hong4]
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
variant of 散[san4]

sentences.english: After the ritualist approach of eating and drinking, people disperse quickly.
sentences.chinese: 在做法事的道场上，人们吃喝一顿然后一哄而散。

sentences.english: The cat catches a fat rat and scatters the others under the mat .
sentences.chinese: 那只猫逮住了一只硕鼠，垫子下面别的老鼠一哄而散。

sentences.english: Then the financial mob turned and there was a frenzy to sell.
sentences.chinese: 最后，金融业的暴徒一哄而散，大家抢着抛售。

sentences.english: The noisy boys scattered when the old man yelled at them.
sentences.chinese: 老人对这群吵闹的男孩一吼，他们便一哄而散。

definition: lit. scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/fig. to head off in various directions/to flee helter-skelter
to scatter in all directions
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions
to scatter like birds and beasts
to disperse/to scatter in all directions
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to swarm around/flocking (to see)
to run away/to escape/to avoid
to flee/to run away
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
boisterous/uproarious
to steal away/to beat it

noisy and in disarray/in an uproar
to take to one's heels/to scram
